alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 12 at 1:51PM EST until November 12 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN AROOSTOOK COUNTY... At 151 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that heavy rain was falling across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, paved and dirt roads as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hodgdon, Sherman, Island Falls, Amity, Haynesville, Reed Plantation, Cary Plantation, Linneus, Cary, Orient, Glenwood, Forkstown, North Amity, Monarda, Silver Ridge and Benedicta. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
